info.title: deployment-handler API
info.description: High-level API for deploying/undeploying composed DCAE services using Cloudify Manager.

tags.name: policy
tags.description: policy update API consumed by policy-handler and debug API to find policies on components

get.description: Returns version information and links to API operations

apiVersion.description: version of API supported by this server

serverVersion.description: version of software running on this server

info.description: path for the server information endpoint

get.description: List service deployments known to the orchestrator, optionally restricted to a single service type

parameters.name: serviceTypeId
parameters.description: Service type identifier for the type whose deployments are to be listed

200.description:
Success. (Note that if no matching deployments are found, the request is still a success; the
deployments array is empty in that case.)

500.description:
Problem on the server side.  See the message
in the response for more details.

502.description:
Error reported to the dispatcher by a downstream system.  See the message
in the response for more details.

504.description:
Error communicating with a downstream system.  See the message
in the response for more details.

put.description: Request deployment of a DCAE service

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Unique deployment identifier assigned by the API client.

202.description:
Success:  The content that was posted is valid, the dispatcher has
  found the needed blueprint, created an instance of the topology in the orchestrator,
  and started an installation workflow.

400.description: Bad request: See the message in the response for details.

409.description: A service with the specified deployment Id already exists.  Using PUT to update the service is not a supported operation.

415.description:
Bad request: The Content-Type header does not indicate that the content is
'application/json'

500.description:
Problem on the server side.  See the message
in the response for more details.

502.description:
Error reported to the dispatcher by a downstream system.  See the message
in the response for more details.

504.description:
Error communicating with a downstream system.  See the message
in the response for more details.

parameters.name: deploymentId

400.description: Bad request: See the message in the response for details.

post.description: policy update API consumed by policy-handler

200.description: deployment-handler always responds with ok to /policy before processing the request

get.description: debug API to find policies on components

200.description: deployment-handler found components with or without policies in cloudify

DCAEDeploymentRequest.description: Request for deploying a DCAE service.

serviceTypeId.description: The service type identifier (a unique ID assigned by DCAE inventory) for the service to be deployed.

inputs.description:
Object containing inputs needed by the service blueprint to create an instance of the service.
Content of the object depends on the service being deployed.

DCAEDeploymentResponse.description: Response body for a PUT or DELETE to /dcae-deployments/{deploymentId}

links.description: Links that the API client can access.

self.description: Link used to retrieve information about the service being deployed

status.description: Link used to retrieve information about the status of the installation workflow

DCAEOperationStatusResponse.description: Response body for a request for status of an installation or uninstallation operation.

requestId.description: A unique identifier assigned to the request.  Useful for tracing a request through logs.

operationType.description: Type of operation being reported on. ("install" or "uninstall")

status.description:
Status of the installation or uninstallation operation.  Possible values are "processing",
"succeeded", and "failed"

error.description: If status is "failed", this field will be present and contain additional information about the reason the operation failed.

links.description: If the operation succeeded, links that the client can follow to take further action.  Note that a successful "uninstall" operation removes the DCAE service instance completely, so there are no possible further actions, and no links.

self.description: Link used to retrieve information about the service.

uninstall.description: Link used to trigger an "uninstall" operation for the service.  (Use the DELETE method.)

status.description: HTTP status code for the response

message.description: Human-readable description of the reason for the error

DCAEDeploymentsListResponse.description: Object providing a list of deployments

DCAEPolicyBody.description: policy_body - the whole object received from policy-engine

policyName.description: unique policy name that contains the version and extension

policyVersion.description: stringified int that is autoincremented by policy-engine

config.description: the policy-config - the config data provided by policy owner

policy_id.description: unique identifier of policy regardless of its version

DCAEPolicyRequest.description: request to update policies on DCAE components.

catch_up.description: flag to indicate whether the request contains all the policies in PDP or not

latest_policies.description:
dictionary of (policy_id -> DCAEPolicy object).
In example: replace additionalProp1,2,3 with policy_id1,2,3 values

removed_policies.description:
whether policy was removed from policy-engine.
dictionary of (policy_id -> true).
In example: replace additionalProp1,2,3 with policy_id1,2,3 values

errored_policies.description:
whether policy-engine returned an error on the policy.
dictionary of (policy_id -> true).
In example: replace additionalProp1,2,3 with policy_id1,2,3 values

errored_scopes.description: on cartchup - list of policy scope_prefix values on wchich the policy-engine experienced an error other than not-found data.

scope_prefixes.description: on catchup - list of all scope_prefixes used by the policy-handler to retrieve the policies from policy-engine.
